mop something/somebody ↔ up.translation[: to remove liquid with a mop, a cloth, or something soft, especially in order to clean a surface
Mop the sauce up with your bread.
He mopped up the spilt milk.
to remove or deal with something which you think is undesirable or dangerous, so that it is no longer a problem
The usual solution is to send in infantry to mop up any remaining opposition.
The rebellion has been crushed, but mopping-up operations may take several weeks.
